result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie B Jones Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jessie B Jones Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jessie B Jones Jr was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Jessie B Jones Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Count one:  Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges including DNA surcharge.   Bail on deposit, if any to apply. Remainder to be paid during period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.  
Count three:  Court found defendant indigent and waived the costs and surcharges.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with firearms.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie B Jones Jr

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessie B Jones in court.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Jessie B Jones in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is calendared for a trial today.  The defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to counts 1 and 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed.
.
Case continued to sentencing..
.
As to counts 1 and 3:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
. 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days served as to count 1 and 3 months in the House of Correction as to count 3, consecutive to count 1, no huber privileges. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 15 months as to both counts, concurrent, with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered as to count 1, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.  Court found the defendant indigent and waived the costs and surcharges as to count 3.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
If defendant complies with all of the conditions set forth by the court, the probation agent may contact the court to terminate the probation earlier.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jessie B Jones in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case was calendared for Jury Trial. State ready to proceed. Defense requests adjournment of trial to allow additional time to contact a witness. Court denies defense request. Court passed the case to allow the parties to discuss the matter. Case recalled on the record. Court advises the parties that due to another trial, this case will be adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jessie B Jones in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Parties are postured for trial. Defense will file witness list by the end of today. Defense asks the court to address the previously filed Motion to Dismiss of Count 2. Arguments heard. The Court DENIES the motion. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on March 30, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. in Br. 36.

Received and filed:
Motion to dismiss due to insufficient complaint.
cab

Defendant Jessie B Jones in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
